name: Security Scoring
description: Scoring template for Security super-sector patents. Covers network security, authentication, threat protection, cryptography, and secure computing.
contextDescription: Security patents protect systems, networks, and data from unauthorized access, threats, and attacks. This super-sector spans network-layer security (firewalls, intrusion detection), authentication/access control, cryptography, secure boot/computing, and data protection technologies.
scoringGuidance: For security patents, consider both the technical strength of the protection mechanism AND the practical deployability.
Patents addressing sophisticated attack vectors (APT, zero-day, supply chain) score higher on threat sophistication.
Component-level security patents (crypto primitives, secure elements) may score lower on security_layer but should score appropriately on their specialized sector questions.
Enterprise security patents targeting compliance (SOC2, NIST, ISO 27001) should score higher on deployment_context when enterprise is applicable.

questions.question: What is the primary security posture of this patent? Score 1-3 for reactive/recovery (incident response, backup/restore), 4-6 for detection/monitoring (SIEM, IDS, anomaly detection), 7-10 for proactive prevention (access control, encryption, hardening).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Classify as prevention, detection, or response and explain the security mechanism.

questions.question: At what layer of the security stack does this patent operate? Score 1-3 for hardware/firmware (TPM, secure boot, TEE), 4-6 for OS/platform (kernel security, sandboxing), 7-10 for network/application (firewalls, auth protocols, API security).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify the primary layer: hardware, OS/platform, or network/application.

questions.question: How sophisticated are the threats this patent addresses? Score 1-3 for basic threats (brute force, simple malware), 4-6 for intermediate threats (known exploits, phishing), 7-10 for advanced threats (APT, zero-day, state-level actors).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Describe the threat level addressed and attack sophistication.

questions.question: What is the target deployment context? Score 1-3 for consumer/IoT devices, 4-6 for SMB/general enterprise, 7-10 for critical infrastructure/government/high-security enterprise.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify the target deployment environment and security requirements.
